Package photos.controller

Class AdminController

java.lang.Object
photos.controller.AdminController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class AdminController extends Object implements Serializable
The controller for the main screen when logged in with a admin user, provides basic functionalities
Since:
4/13/23
Author:
Zihao Zheng , Yiming Huang

  • Constructor Details

    • AdminController

      public AdminController()

  • Method Details

    • logout

      public void logout() throws IOException
      Logs out the current user and displays the login page. A confirmation dialog is first displayed to confirm the action. If the user confirms the action, the login page is loaded and displayed. Otherwise, the method returns without doing anything.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error loading the login page.

    • viewUserList

      public void viewUserList() throws IOException
      Loads the UserList.fxml file and displays it as a new scene. The UserListController class is used as the controller for this scene.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error loading the FXML file

    • createUser

      public void createUser() throws IOException
      Creates a pop-up dialog window for creating a new user with a username, password, and type. If the user successfully enters a username and password, and the username does not already exist, a new user object is created, added to the backend, and serialized to the cloud. A new user space is also created on the local machine. If the user cancels the creation process or enters invalid input, the dialog window is closed without creating a new user object. After the creation process is complete, the user list view is updated.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the new user space on the local machine or when serializing the updated backend to the data file

    • createFolder

      public static void createFolder(String parentPath, String folderName) throws IOException
      Creates a new folder with the specified name in the parent directory specified by parentPath.
      Parameters:
      parentPath - the path of the parent directory
      folderName - the name of the folder to be created
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error creating the folder

    • checkExistence

      public boolean checkExistence(String userName)
      Checks if a user with the given username already exists in the Privacy system.
      Parameters:
      userName - the username to check
      Returns:
      true if a user with the given username exists, false otherwise

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser() throws IOException
      Opens a pop-up dialog window to prompt the user to enter a username to delete. If the username is found in the list of users, it is removed from the list and its associated folder is moved to the trash directory. The user is then redirected to the UserList view.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while serializing the user data

    • deleteFile

      public boolean deleteFile(String filePath)
      Deletes a file from the file system.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path of the file to be deleted
      Returns:
      true if the file was successfully deleted, false otherwise

    • moveToTrash

      public boolean moveToTrash(String filePath)
      Moves the file or directory at the specified path to the trash or recycle bin, depending on the operating system. If moving to trash or recycle bin fails, the file or directory is deleted.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path of the file or directory to be moved to trash or recycle bin
      Returns:
      true if the file or directory was moved to trash or recycle bin or deleted successfully, false otherwise

    • setMainStage

      public void setMainStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws IOException
      Sets the main stage of the application and updates the welcome message to display the admin username.
      Parameters:
      stage - The main stage of the application.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
